intro: Prionosciadium simplex, commonly known as the slender cowpea, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white or greenish flowers. The plant produces small, oval fruits that contain several seeds, and its leaves are typically compound with several leaflets. Prionosciadium simplex is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and is also used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
